meanings.definition: Of or relating to an embryo.
meanings.sent1: The tiny bird had an embryotic beak.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryotic development of the frog.
meanings.sent3: The embryotic plant seemed to be shyly peeking out of the soil.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were still in an embryotic stage, waiting to fully bloom.
meanings.sent5: The embryotic features of the baby were evident in the ultrasound.

meanings.definition: In an early stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The project was still in an embryotic phase.
meanings.sent2: The city was in an embryotic state before it grew into a bustling metropolis.
meanings.sent3: The embryotic idea of a flying car made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His embryotic talent for painting blossomed into a successful career.
meanings.sent5: The embryotic buds on the tree promised a beautiful spring ahead.
